tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE ProductionSchedule (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_name VARCHAR(255),
  production_date DATE,
  quantity INT,
  completed BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE quality_control_data (
    qc_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    schedule_id INT,
    test_name VARCHAR(255),
    test_result VARCHAR(50),
    FOREIGN KEY (schedule_id) REFERENCES production_schedule(schedule_id)
);

CREATE TABLE quality_control (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_name VARCHAR(255),
    check_date DATE,
    passed BOOLEAN,
    remarks TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE products (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_name VARCHAR(255),
    description TEXT,
    price DECIMAL(10, 2),
    production_schedule_id INT REFERENCES production_schedule(id),
    quality_control_id INT REFERENCES quality_control(id)
);

CREATE TABLE production_schedule (
  production_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  product_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  production_date DATE NOT NULL,
  production_quantity INT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE quality_control (
  control_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  production_id INT REFERENCES production_schedule(production_id),
  quality_rating INT NOT NULL,
  inspection_date DATE NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE ingredient_suppliers (
  supplier_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  supplier_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  supplier_contact VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  supplier_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE ingredients (
  ingredient_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  ingredient_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  supplier_id INT REFERENCES ingredient_suppliers(supplier_id),
  ingredient_quantity INT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE employee (
  employee_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  employee_role VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  employee_salary DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL
)
